    • Method Detail

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(GL10 unused)

      • loadTextures

        public void loadTextures(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> resources)
        Loads every resource in the given list as formal OpenGL textures. After calling this function, each resource specified will be available for rendering. Do not load the same resource multiple times, as it will waste memory.

        Use #getTexture(resource) to grab the generated Texture for a previously-loaded resource.

        Remember that OpenGL is threaded in this application; the textures will load at the end of the current frame, so don't count on them being available right after calling this function!

        Parameters:
        resources - the list of resources to load

      • addDrawable

        public void addDrawable(Drawable drawable)
        Adds a Drawable to the rendering list. After calling this function, the added Drawable members advance and draw will begin to be called automatically.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the drawable object to add

      • getTexture

        public Texture getTexture(int resource)
        Gets the Texture associated with resource. This resource must have already been loaded with #loadTextures(resources).
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to get the Texture for
        Returns:
        the Texture associated with resource

      • loadShader

        public static int loadShader(java.lang.String vert,
             java.lang.String frag)
        Compiles the given shader. Does NOT validate the shader.
        Parameters:
        vert - the vertex shader, given as a String
        frag - the fragment shader, given as a String
        Returns:
        the shader program ID corresponding to the newly-compiled shader. Returns 0 on error
